text:
Hi there Adeshewa, sorry for my delayed answer. This end of week is a delivery for the current episode I'm working on, so work has been pretty heavy. Please call me Marcelo, it's alright :)
Nice to hear you're working on this project, and that you're able to put effort on something like this while at school!
I must tell you I'm not very familiar with mangas, the only one I read is 'Blade of the immortal' which I liked very much because the storytelling is great, the rhythm and storyboarding (if you consider it as a storyboard) are really well done.
It's good you're aware of points you'd like to improve in your drawings, and anatomy and perspective are among the most difficult, it's a lifelong thing to get it better, no worries to understand everything there is to it in a short time, I'd say :)

Hello Marcelo! 

If you don't mind, what episode were you working on ( so I can go watch it when it comes out ) and what does your job involve? :blush: 

I shall go check out Blade of the Immortal! A good story is always hard to come by because so many people has done the same thing, as a famous theorist once said, "A genre is repetition with difference." 

Story telling and perspective is so hard :cold_sweat: because you have to make the panels move in a way that makes the readers eyes flow with the movement but I will practice! Once I get my character references done, would it be okay to send the images to you and you could maybe critique them? :) 

Have a good rest Marcelo and don't overwork yourself! :blush:
